Convert Ensembl Identifiers to Gene Symbols

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/convertGenesToSymbols-methods.R
convertGenesToSymbols.Rd

Convert Ensembl Identifiers to Gene Symbols

convertGenesToSymbols(object, ...)

convertSymbolsToGenes(object, ...)

# S4 method for character
convertGenesToSymbols(object, gene2symbol = NULL,
  organism = NULL, build = NULL, release = NULL)

# S4 method for matrix
convertGenesToSymbols(object, gene2symbol = NULL,
  organism = NULL, build = NULL, release = NULL)

# S4 method for sparseMatrix
convertGenesToSymbols(object,
  gene2symbol = NULL, organism = NULL, build = NULL,
  release = NULL)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
convertGenesToSymbols(object)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
convertSymbolsToGenes(object)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments.
gene2symbol

data.frame or NULL. Gene-to-symbol mappings. If set NULL, the function will attempt to download the mappings from Ensembl automatically.
organism

string. Full latin organism name (e.g. "Homo sapiens").
build

string or NULL. Genome build assembly name (e.g. "GRCh38"). If set NULL, defaults to the most recent build available.
release

scalar integer or NULL. Release version (e.g. 90). If set NULL, defaults to the most recent release available.

Value

Object with gene IDs converted to names (symbols).

See also

Other Annotation Functions: convertTranscriptsToGenes, convertUCSCBuildToEnsembl, eggnog, emptyRanges, ensembl2entrez, gene2symbol, geneSynonyms, hgnc2ensembl, makeGRanges, makeGene2symbol, makeTx2gene, mgi2ensembl, organism, panther, stripTranscriptVersions

Examples

gene2symbol <- makeGene2symbolFromEnsembl("Mus musculus")
#> Making GRanges from Ensembl with AnnotationHub 2.13.7 (2018-10-04)...
#> Ensembl 93 EnsDb for Mus Musculus
#>   - AnnotationHub: "AH64461"
#>   - Organism: "Mus musculus"
#>   - Build: "GRCm38"
#>   - Release: "93"
#>   - Level: "genes"
#> Defining broadClass using: geneName, geneBiotype, seqnames
#> Arranging by geneID...
print(gene2symbol)
#> gene2symbol with 55029 rows and 2 columns
#>                                geneID    geneName
#>                           <character> <character>
#> ENSMUSG00000000001 ENSMUSG00000000001       Gnai3
#> ENSMUSG00000000003 ENSMUSG00000000003        Pbsn
#> ENSMUSG00000000028 ENSMUSG00000000028       Cdc45
#> ENSMUSG00000000031 ENSMUSG00000000031         H19
#> ENSMUSG00000000037 ENSMUSG00000000037       Scml2
#> ...                               ...         ...
#> ENSMUSG00000116995 ENSMUSG00000116995  AC110534.5
#> ENSMUSG00000116996 ENSMUSG00000116996  AC154540.3
#> ENSMUSG00000116997 ENSMUSG00000116997  CT030736.1
#> ENSMUSG00000116998 ENSMUSG00000116998  AC109266.1
#> ENSMUSG00000116999 ENSMUSG00000116999  AC154275.2
geneIDs <- c("ENSMUSG00000000001", "ENSMUSG00000000003")
sampleIDs = paste0("sample", seq_len(2L))

# character ====
x <- convertGenesToSymbols(geneIDs, gene2symbol = gene2symbol)
print(x)
#> ENSMUSG00000000001 ENSMUSG00000000003 
#>            "Gnai3"             "Pbsn" 

# matrix ====
counts <- matrix(
    data = seq_len(length(geneIDs) * length(sampleIDs)),
    byrow = TRUE,
    nrow = length(geneIDs),
    ncol = length(sampleIDs),
    dimnames = list(geneIDs, sampleIDs)
)
print(counts)
#>                    sample1 sample2
#> ENSMUSG00000000001       1       2
#> ENSMUSG00000000003       3       4
x <- convertGenesToSymbols(counts, gene2symbol = gene2symbol)
print(x)
#>       sample1 sample2
#> Gnai3       1       2
#> Pbsn        3       4

# SummarizedExperiment ====
x <- convertGenesToSymbols(rse_small)
print(x)
#> class: RangedSummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 50 4 
#> metadata(3): version date interestingGroups
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames(50): TSPAN6 TNMD ... PLXND1 AK2
#> rowData names(5): geneID geneName geneBiotype broadClass entrezID
#> colnames(4): sample1 sample2 sample3 sample4
#> colData names(2): genotype treatment
# Interconvert back to gene IDs.
y <- convertSymbolsToGenes(x)
print(y)
#> class: RangedSummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 50 4 
#> metadata(3): version date interestingGroups
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames(50): ENSG00000000003 ENSG00000000005 ... ENSG00000004399
#>   ENSG00000004455
#> rowData names(5): geneID geneName geneBiotype broadClass entrezID
#> colnames(4): sample1 sample2 sample3 sample4
#> colData names(2): genotype treatment
